bug.author: sahilmalav
bug.summary: kfctl init flag --namespace doesn't change the kubeflow installation namespace
bug.description:
/kind bug I'm trying to install Kubeflow 0.6.1. For this, I downloaded and unzipped kfctl, and executed kfctl init ${KFAPP} --namespace=kubeflow-six --config=${CONFIG} -V Post this, when I did kfctl generate all -V, the app.yaml file still had namespace mentioned as "kubeflow" instead of "kubeflow-six", as I had mentioned in the flag. Expected Behaviour : The namespace should have been "kubeflow-six" instead of the default "kubeflow". Environment:
Kubeflow version: v0.6.1 kfctl version: kfctl v0.6.1-rc.2-1-g3a37cbc6 Kubernetes platform: Kubeadm Kubernetes version: : v1.14.1 OS : Ubuntu 18.04LTS

Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
What's your configuration file? Can you paste it here? I am wondering what's the priority of kf configuration and kfctl flags. Which one should have higher priority?

I was expecting that providing a namespace flag will change the value of namespace in the app.yaml file. But that didn't happen. Moreover, when I manually changed it and tried deploying, istio threw some error because it was searching for namespace "kubeflow".
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
